headline: Tesla Dumped Most of Its Bitcoin in 2022, But How Much Profit Would It Have Made If It Hadn‚Äôt Sold?
summary: Tesla disappointed by missing both revenue and profit expectations in the second quarter of 2025. But there was another striking detail in the company's investor presentation: Tesla's digital assets. The company's digital asset portfolio is currently valued at $1.24 billion. While this represents a significant increase from $722 million in the same period last year, given Bitcoin's 80% appreciation in the past year, this increase actually means Tesla is missing out on billions of dollars in potential earnings. The electric vehicle giant announced its confidence in the cryptocurrency's long-term potential by investing $1.5 billion in Bitcoin at the beginning of 2021. At the time, CEO Elon Musk's social media outcry supporting Bitcoin had a significant impact on the crypto market. However, in mid-2022, Tesla sold 75% of its Bitcoin holdings. At the time, Bitcoin was trading well below its current value. Today, Bitcoin is nearing $119,000. Had Tesla held Bitcoin assets at the time, the investment would have reached a current value of approximately $5 billion. The $936 million in Bitcoin the company liquidated in 2022 would be worth approximately $3.5 billion today. Related News: Wall Street Giant Citi Has Released Its New Predictions for the Price of Bitcoin: ‚ÄúIn a Pessimistic Scenario, $64,000; In an Optimistic Scenario...‚Äù Tesla announced the decision to strengthen its cash position amid significant market turmoil during the quarter it sold cryptocurrencies. The company lost two-thirds of its market capitalization in 2022, while Bitcoin fell by 60%. However, market conditions have shifted. Bitcoin has undergone a rapid recovery over the past two years. US President Donald Trump's plan to ease regulations and establish a strategic Bitcoin reserve has been one of the factors supporting this rise. Tesla reported a $284 million Bitcoin-fueled profit in the second quarter of 2025. However, this profit represents only a small fraction of the potential return. The company's net income was $1.17 billion in the period, while car sales revenue declined for the second consecutive quarter. Musk has toned down his social media posts about cryptocurrencies in recent years. In March 2022, shortly before Tesla's Bitcoin sale, he said, ‚ÄúI'm still holding my Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Dogecoin, and I won't be selling them.‚Äù *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Tesla Dumped Most of Its Bitcoin in 2022, But How Much Profit Would It Have Made If It Hadn‚Äôt Sold?

headline: Institutions Keep Stacking Bitcoin (BTC) as Price Dips Below $115K
summary: Volcon and Refine Group AB Buy the Dip as BTC Supply on Exchanges Hits Multi-Year Low Bitcoin dipped under $115,000, and institutions didn‚Äôt blink. Instead, they bought more. As BTC traded between $114,000 and $119,000, a fresh wave of corporate accumulation kicked in. Trading volume surged 40% in 24 hours. Buyers saw opportunity. They acted. At the time of writing, Bitcoin trades at $116,200, with a market cap of $2.46 trillion and 24-hour volume sitting at $45 billion, according to CoinMarketCap. Supply on centralized exchanges has now dropped to just 2.1 million BTC‚Äîthe lowest since 2018. That‚Äôs a strong signal of conviction from long-term holders. Volcon Goes Big on BTC U.S.-based electric vehicle company Volcon made headlines by scooping up 2,903 BTC in a single day, raising its total holdings to 3,183 BTC. The company‚Äôs CFO called it a strategic play‚Äîhedging fiat risk and locking in long-term upside while prices sit below all-time highs. ‚ÄúWe see Bitcoin fitting our long-term view,‚Äù the CFO said, noting that their treasury acted quickly once the price dipped. It‚Äôs a bold, high-conviction bet‚Äîand one that mirrors moves from other major corporate players. Sweden‚Äôs Refine Group Backs Digital Gold Swedish tech and investment firm Refine Group AB also made a move, raising 5 million SEK (about $520,000 USD) and channeling those funds directly into Bitcoin. Their CFO explained the decision as one rooted in capital preservation and diversification, viewing BTC as ‚Äúdigital gold‚Äù in an era of inflation and macro uncertainty. Refine Group AB huy ƒë·ªông th√™m 5 tri·ªáu SEK (kho·∫£ng 520.000 USD) v·ªõi m·ª•c‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/G6JHQ8HUab ‚Äî ThuanCapital (@ThuanCapital) July 25, 2025 Their timing matches the broader sentiment. With price weakness and improving regulatory clarity, firms are seeing this as the right moment to stack. The Trend: Corporate Accumulation Is Heating Up This isn‚Äôt isolated behavior. Over the past year, we‚Äôve watched the corporate accumulation playbook evolve. Tesla led the charge. MicroStrategy doubled down. Then came Cornerstone, Marathon, and now Volcon and Refine Group AB. Across sectors‚ÄîEVs, miners, tech, and investment firms‚Äî Bitcoin is becoming a strategic asset. The 40% spike in trading volume underscores what‚Äôs happening: institutional conviction is rising. Deep liquidity and low supply create a setup where large buyers move quietly, yet meaningfully. These aren‚Äôt retail frenzies. These are calculated treasury decisions. According to CoinMarketCap , Bitcoin dominance has climbed to 54.2%. Active addresses remain high, with over 1.2 million interacting with the network in the past 24 hours. BTC‚Äôs utility remains strong even in a volatile market. If Bitcoin can hold above $115,000, more companies are expected to step in. If it slips below $110,000, dry powder from institutional desks may flood in quickly. Either way, corporate treasuries are watching closely, and many are ready to buy. Right now, companies aren‚Äôt waiting for perfect timing. They‚Äôre moving on conviction. They see Bitcoin as scarce, durable, and increasingly strategic. With exchange supply at a six-year low and volume ramping up, the accumulation trend is nowhere near done. Disclosure: This is not trading or investment advice. Always do your research before buying any cryptocurrency or investing in any services. headline: Jerome Powell‚Äôs Unwavering Resolve: What His Non-Resignation Means for Markets
summary: BitcoinWorld Jerome Powell‚Äôs Unwavering Resolve: What His Non-Resignation Means for Markets In the dynamic world of finance, where every whisper from a central bank can send ripples across global markets, news about leadership stability is paramount. For cryptocurrency enthusiasts and traditional investors alike, the Federal Reserve‚Äôs actions, heavily influenced by its chairman, hold immense sway. Recently, a significant piece of news emerged that provides a crucial sense of continuity: Jerome Powell , the current Chairman of the U.S. Federal Reserve, has reportedly informed his colleagues that he has no intention of resigning. This update, initially shared by Watcher Guru via X, signals a period of continued leadership at the helm of America‚Äôs central bank, and its implications for the economy, inflation, and indeed, the volatile crypto markets, are worth a closer look. What‚Äôs the Buzz About Jerome Powell‚Äôs Stance? The financial community has been buzzing with speculation regarding the future of leadership at the Federal Reserve. The Fed‚Äôs decisions on interest rates and monetary policy profoundly impact everything from mortgage rates to stock market valuations and, crucially, the flow of capital into risk assets like cryptocurrencies. When there‚Äôs uncertainty at the top, markets tend to react with apprehension. The confirmation that Jerome Powell intends to complete his term brings a degree of predictability to the economic outlook. This isn‚Äôt just a simple personnel announcement; it‚Äôs a signal of consistency in a period marked by significant economic challenges, including persistent inflation and concerns about economic growth. For investors, this means they can likely anticipate a continuation of the Fed‚Äôs current policy trajectory, which has been focused on bringing inflation down to its 2% target without causing an undue recession. Stability Signal: Powell‚Äôs decision offers a steady hand in guiding monetary policy. Market Confidence: Reduces uncertainty, potentially fostering more stable market conditions. Policy Continuity: Suggests the current inflation-fighting strategy will persist. Decoding the Federal Reserve‚Äôs Role and Jerome Powell‚Äôs Leadership To fully grasp the weight of Jerome Powell‚Äôs decision, it‚Äôs essential to understand the Federal Reserve‚Äôs pivotal role. The Fed acts as the central bank of the United States, tasked with a dual mandate: Maximum Employment: Striving for the lowest unemployment rate consistent with price stability. Price Stability: Keeping inflation at a manageable and predictable level (typically around 2%). Under Powell‚Äôs leadership, which began in February 2018, the Fed has navigated several unprecedented economic events. From the swift interest rate cuts during the COVID-19 pandemic to the aggressive rate hikes initiated in 2022 to combat soaring inflation, Powell‚Äôs tenure has been defined by decisive, albeit sometimes controversial, actions. His approach has often emphasized data-driven decisions, with a clear focus on the inflation fight, even if it means tightening financial conditions. The Fed employs several tools to achieve its mandate: Federal Funds Rate: The primary tool, influencing borrowing costs across the economy. Quantitative Easing (QE) / Quantitative Tightening (QT): Buying or selling government bonds to inject or withdraw liquidity from the financial system. Bank Reserve Requirements: Though less frequently used, these dictate how much money banks must hold in reserve. Powell‚Äôs continuity means that the architect of the current economic strategy remains in place, suggesting that the existing framework for addressing inflation and managing economic growth will largely be maintained. How Does Jerome Powell‚Äôs Continuity Impact Monetary Policy? The decision by Jerome Powell to remain at the helm carries significant implications for the direction of U.S. monetary policy. A change in leadership could introduce new philosophies, potentially altering the Fed‚Äôs approach to inflation, employment, and financial stability. Powell‚Äôs continuity, however, suggests a steady hand on the tiller. Here‚Äôs what his continued tenure likely means for monetary policy: Aspect of Policy Impact of Powell‚Äôs Continuity Alternative (New Leadership) Inflation Target Continued commitment to the 2% target, with a willingness to maintain restrictive policy until achieved. Potentially a re-evaluation of the target or a more dovish/hawkish stance. Interest Rates Likely a data-dependent approach, with further hikes or cuts contingent on inflation and employment data. Predictability in the rate path. Uncertainty regarding future rate trajectory, potentially more volatile market reactions. Quantitative Tightening (QT) Continuation of balance sheet reduction, aiming to drain excess liquidity from the system. Possible acceleration or deceleration of QT, depending on new leadership‚Äôs views. Communication Consistent communication style, providing clear guidance on the Fed‚Äôs intentions and economic outlook. New communication style, potentially requiring markets to adjust to new signals. This consistency can reduce market volatility, as investors have a clearer understanding of the Fed‚Äôs objectives and potential actions. It allows businesses and consumers to make more informed decisions, knowing that the central bank‚Äôs policy direction is less likely to undergo a sudden shift. The Ripple Effect: Jerome Powell‚Äôs Decision and Cryptocurrency Markets For those deeply entrenched in the world of digital assets, the Federal Reserve‚Äôs actions are not just abstract economic theories; they have tangible, immediate impacts. Jerome Powell‚Äôs continued leadership has specific implications for cryptocurrency markets, which are highly sensitive to liquidity and interest rate changes. Cryptocurrencies, particularly Bitcoin and Ethereum, are often viewed as risk-on assets. This means they tend to perform well when there is ample liquidity in the financial system and when interest rates are low, making traditional investments less attractive. Conversely, when the Fed tightens monetary policy by raising rates and reducing its balance sheet, it drains liquidity, making capital more expensive and risk assets less appealing. Here‚Äôs how Powell‚Äôs continuity could influence crypto: Predictable Tightening: If Powell continues his inflation-fighting stance, expect the Fed to remain cautious about easing monetary policy too soon. This means higher-for-longer interest rates could persist, potentially acting as a headwind for crypto valuations in the short to medium term. Liquidity Management: The ongoing quantitative tightening (QT) will continue to remove liquidity from the financial system. Less liquidity generally means less capital flowing into speculative assets like crypto. Macro-Economic Correlation: Crypto markets have shown a strong correlation with traditional financial markets, especially tech stocks. Powell‚Äôs policy direction will continue to influence the broader market sentiment, which in turn affects crypto. Long-Term Stability: While short-term pain from tightening might occur, a successful disinflationary path under Powell could eventually lead to a more stable economic environment, which is beneficial for all asset classes in the long run. Investors might appreciate the clarity over uncertainty. It‚Äôs crucial for crypto investors to monitor not just the Fed‚Äôs official statements but also economic data points like the Consumer Price Index (CPI) and employment reports, as these are the primary drivers of Powell‚Äôs policy decisions. Navigating Economic Challenges Under Jerome Powell‚Äôs Watch Despite the signal of continuity, the economic landscape remains complex. Jerome Powell and the Federal Reserve still face significant challenges that will shape their policy decisions moving forward. These include: Persistent Inflation: While inflation has eased from its peaks, bringing it consistently down to the 2% target without causing a recession remains a delicate balancing act. Supply chain disruptions, geopolitical tensions, and wage pressures could keep inflation elevated. Labor Market Dynamics: The U.S. labor market has remained remarkably resilient. However, a cooling labor market might be necessary to further ease inflation. The Fed will be closely watching unemployment rates and wage growth. Global Economic Slowdown: Weakness in major economies outside the U.S. could spill over, impacting U.S. exports and corporate earnings, potentially leading to a domestic slowdown. Financial Stability Risks: Rapid changes in interest rates can expose vulnerabilities in the financial system, as seen with regional bank issues. The Fed must balance its inflation fight with maintaining financial stability. Powell‚Äôs experience in navigating previous crises will be crucial in addressing these multifaceted challenges. His non-resignation implies a commitment to see the current inflation fight through, even if it means facing difficult trade-offs. Actionable Insights for Investors Given Jerome Powell‚Äôs continued leadership and the Federal Reserve‚Äôs current policy trajectory, here are some actionable insights for investors, especially those in the crypto space: Stay Informed on Macro Data: Pay close attention to key economic indicators like CPI, PCE (Personal Consumption Expenditures) inflation, jobs reports, and GDP growth. These will dictate the Fed‚Äôs next moves. Monitor Fed Communications: Listen to Powell‚Äôs speeches and read FOMC meeting minutes. Any shifts in language or tone can provide clues about future policy. Assess Risk Tolerance: Understand that higher interest rates can increase the cost of capital and reduce appetite for riskier assets. Re-evaluate your portfolio‚Äôs risk exposure. Long-Term Perspective: While short-term volatility is likely, focus on the long-term fundamentals of your investments. For crypto, this means understanding project utility and adoption rather than just speculative price movements. Diversification: Consider a diversified portfolio that can withstand various economic scenarios, including periods of tighter monetary policy. Jerome Powell‚Äôs decision not to resign brings a much-needed element of stability and predictability to the U.S. economic outlook. For financial markets, including the volatile cryptocurrency space, this means a likely continuation of the current monetary policy strategy focused on taming inflation. While challenges remain, Powell‚Äôs unwavering resolve at the Federal Reserve‚Äôs helm provides a clear signal that the fight against inflation will continue with a consistent approach. Investors should remain vigilant, focusing on macro-economic data and the Fed‚Äôs communications to navigate the evolving financial landscape effectively. This continuity, while potentially leading to sustained restrictive policies, also lays the groundwork for long-term economic stability, which ultimately benefits all market participants. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) 1. Why is Jerome Powell‚Äôs decision not to resign significant? Jerome Powell‚Äôs decision signals continuity and predictability in U.S. monetary policy. His continued leadership means the Federal Reserve‚Äôs current strategy for combating inflation and managing the economy is likely to persist, reducing market uncertainty and providing a clearer outlook for investors. 2. How does the Federal Reserve‚Äôs policy impact cryptocurrency markets? The Federal Reserve‚Äôs monetary policy, particularly interest rate decisions and liquidity management (Quantitative Tightening), significantly impacts cryptocurrency markets. Higher interest rates and reduced liquidity tend to make riskier assets like crypto less attractive, potentially leading to price headwinds. Conversely, lower rates and increased liquidity can boost crypto valuations. 3. What are the Federal Reserve‚Äôs main objectives under Jerome Powell? Under Jerome Powell, the Federal Reserve‚Äôs main objectives, known as its dual mandate, are to achieve maximum employment and maintain price stability (keeping inflation around 2%). Powell has consistently emphasized the fight against inflation as a top priority in recent years. 4. What economic challenges does Jerome Powell face going forward? Jerome Powell and the Federal Reserve face challenges such as persistent inflation, managing a resilient yet potentially cooling labor market, navigating a global economic slowdown, and mitigating financial stability risks while pursuing their policy goals. 5. What should investors watch for in light of this news? Investors should closely monitor key economic indicators like inflation reports (CPI, PCE), employment data, and GDP growth. Additionally, paying attention to Jerome Powell‚Äôs speeches and Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting minutes will provide crucial insights into future monetary policy decisions. Did you find this article insightful? Share it with your friends and fellow investors on social media to help them understand the implications of Jerome Powell‚Äôs continued leadership at the Federal Reserve! headline: Tether‚Äôs Mining OS Set to Go Open Source by End-of-Year, Confirms Paolo Ardoino
summary: MOS scales from home setups to large farms with hundreds of thousands of machines. MOS reduces vendor lock-in, giving miners full control over their infrastructure. Tether plans to surpass public mining firms and lead global Bitcoin mining by the end of 2025. Tether CEO Paolo Ardoino confirmed that by the end-of-year (EOY), the company will release the Bitcoin Mining OS (MOS) under an open‚Äësource license. This operating system is designed to operate at scales, from small home setups to full industrial mining farms with hundreds of thousands of machines. Testing new version of Mining OS by Tether Open-sourcing process on track for EOY. pic.twitter.com/wTbaY7Rmxs ‚Äî Paolo Ardoino (@paoloardoino) July 25, 2025 Ardoino said that the new version of the OS is currently being tested. It was stated that MOS will feature a modular, peer‚Äëto‚Äëpeer IoT architecture supporting a variety of setups, such as air‚Äëcooled, immersion, and different electrical and cooling systems. Tether‚Äôs goal is to reduce the reliance on third‚Äëparty vendors, as MOS will give miners autonomy over their infrastructure, breaking dependence on proprietary software providers and re‚Ä¶ The post Tether‚Äôs Mining OS Set to Go Open Source by End-of-Year, Confirms Paolo Ardoino appeared first on Coin Edition .

headline: US Semiconductor Market: Unveiling the Crucial 2025 Transformations in AI Chips and Export Controls
summary: BitcoinWorld US Semiconductor Market: Unveiling the Crucial 2025 Transformations in AI Chips and Export Controls The digital frontier, from groundbreaking AI models to the intricate networks powering cryptocurrencies, hinges on one foundational element: semiconductors. In 2025, the US semiconductor market experienced a whirlwind of innovation, geopolitical maneuvering, and strategic shifts, shaping not just the future of computing but the very landscape of global technological dominance. This year proved to be a pivotal chapter in the ongoing ‚ÄòAI race,‚Äô with every move by industry giants and government bodies sending ripples across the globe. How is Intel Reshaping its Future in the US Semiconductor Market ? For a legacy giant like Intel , 2025 was a year of profound introspection and aggressive restructuring. Under the new leadership of CEO Lip-Bu Tan, who took the helm in March, the company immediately signaled a decisive shift towards becoming an ‚Äòengineering-focused company‚Äô once again. Tan, a seasoned industry veteran and former board member, wasted no time implementing his vision, initiating a series of bold, albeit challenging, strategic moves designed to revitalize the company‚Äôs core: New Leadership Appointments: In June, Intel announced several high-profile engineering hires and a new chief revenue officer, reinforcing its commitment to technical excellence and market penetration. Significant Layoffs: Rumors from April materialized into reality in June, as Intel began laying off a substantial portion of its Intel Foundry staff, with plans to eliminate 15% to 20% of workers in that business unit by July. These layoffs were part of Tan‚Äôs strategy to ‚Äòflatten the organization‚Äô and reduce operational redundancies. Manufacturing Consolidation: A major announcement in July confirmed Intel was pulling back on some of its previously ambitious manufacturing operations. Projects in Germany and Poland were halted, and test operations were consolidated, indicating a strategic pivot towards efficiency and optimized resource allocation rather than broad expansion. The company also set a target to end the year with around 75,000 employees, reflecting a leaner operational model. Potential Asset Offloading: In May, reports surfaced that Intel was exploring spinning off non-core business units, specifically its networking and edge units, which contributed significantly to its 2024 revenue. This move aligns with Tan‚Äôs focus on streamlining operations and concentrating on core semiconductor innovation. Ohio Plant Delay: A setback occurred in February, with the delay of Intel‚Äôs $28 billion chip fabrication plant in Ohio for the second time. Construction is now not expected to wrap up until 2030, with operations potentially starting in 2031, highlighting the immense capital and time commitment involved in advanced manufacturing. These actions demonstrate Intel ‚Äòs fierce determination to regain its competitive edge in the highly dynamic US semiconductor market , especially as the demand for high-performance chips for AI applications continues to soar. What Challenges Do AI Chip Export Restrictions Pose? The year 2025 was dominated by an evolving and often contentious debate around AI chip export restrictions , reflecting deep national security concerns and the fierce competition for technological supremacy between the U.S. and China. The regulatory landscape shifted dramatically, creating uncertainty and significant financial implications for leading semiconductor firms: Biden‚Äôs Sweeping Proposal (January): Just days before leaving office, former President Joe Biden proposed a comprehensive three-tier structure for U.S.-made AI chip exports. This framework aimed to control chip purchases by countries based on their perceived risk, with Tier 1 facing no restrictions, Tier 2 facing new limits, and Tier 3 facing additional stringent controls. A Last-Minute Reversal (May): Despite Biden‚Äôs proposal, the Trump administration, upon taking office, chose a different path. The ‚ÄòFramework for Artificial Intelligence Diffusion‚Äô was formally rescinded by the U.S. Department of Commerce in May, with promises of new guidance to come. However, the DOC reiterated that using Huawei‚Äôs Ascend AI chips anywhere in the world remained a violation of U.S. export rules, signaling continued vigilance. Trump‚Äôs AI Action Plan (July): The Trump administration unveiled its own AI Action Plan, emphasizing the need for U.S. chip export controls and coordination with allies. While the plan lacked concrete details on restrictions, it reinforced the strategic importance of controlling advanced semiconductor technology. Increased Licensing Requirements (April): Nvidia ‚Äòs H20 AI chips , designed for the Chinese market, were hit with new export licensing requirements. This move, which also impacted TSMC and Intel, resulted in significant charges for companies, with Nvidia alone expecting a $5.5 billion hit in Q1 of its 2026 fiscal year due to these restrictions. Anthropic‚Äôs Stance: AI startup Anthropic consistently advocated for stricter chip export controls, even suggesting tweaks to the diffusion framework to impose further restrictions on Tier 2 countries. This stance was met with strong opposition from chip manufacturers like Nvidia, who argued that American firms should focus on innovation rather than overly restrictive policies. These shifting policies underscore the complex balancing act between fostering innovation, protecting national security, and maintaining global trade relationships. The uncertainty surrounding export restrictions continues to be a major factor influencing investment and development in the US semiconductor market . Who‚Äôs Winning the AI Chips Race: Nvidia vs. AMD? The competition for dominance in the AI chips market intensified significantly in 2025, primarily featuring a fierce rivalry between Nvidia and AMD. Both companies made strategic moves to capture market share and navigate the challenging regulatory environment: Nvidia‚Äôs China Conundrum: Facing the brunt of export restrictions , Nvidia reported a staggering $4.5 billion in charges in Q1 due to U.S. licensing requirements on its H20 AI chips , with an expected $8 billion hit in Q2 revenue. CEO Jensen Huang announced in June that the company would no longer include the Chinese market in future revenue forecasts, indicating a strategic shift away from reliance on this restricted market. Despite this, Nvidia did file an application in July to restart sales of H20 AI chips in China and even announced a new chip, the RTX Pro, specifically designed for the Chinese market, showcasing its persistent efforts to maintain a foothold. AMD‚Äôs Aggressive Expansion: AMD, a formidable competitor, embarked on an aggressive acquisition spree to bolster its AI capabilities and challenge Nvidia‚Äôs lead. In May, it acquired Enosemi, a silicon photonics startup whose light-based data transmission technology is gaining increasing interest in the semiconductor industry. This was followed by the acqui-hire of Untether AI‚Äôs team in June, a company known for developing AI inference chips, further strengthening AMD‚Äôs talent pool. Just days later, AMD acquired Brium, an AI software optimization startup that helps adapt AI software to various hardware, a crucial move given much AI software is designed with Nvidia hardware in mind. These acquisitions clearly signal AMD‚Äôs intent to capture a larger share of the burgeoning AI chips market. The battle between these two giants highlights the critical importance of specialized AI chips in driving the next wave of technological innovation and the lengths companies will go to secure their position in this high-stakes arena. How Do Geopolitics Influence the US Semiconductor Market ? Beyond corporate strategies and domestic policies, global geopolitics played an undeniable role in shaping the US semiconductor market in 2025. The interplay between international relations, trade, and national security had direct consequences on supply chains and market access: The UAE AI Deal on Hold (July): A groundbreaking deal brokered by the Trump administration in May, which would have seen the United Arab Emirates purchase billions of dollars worth of AI chips from Nvidia , was reportedly put on hold. This suspension stemmed from U.S. national security concerns and fears that these advanced chips could be illicitly diverted from the Middle East to China, underscoring the U.S.‚Äôs determination to control the end-use of its advanced technology. Malaysia‚Äôs Export Controls (July): In a move reflecting the global ripple effect of U.S. export restrictions , Malaysia announced it would launch trade permits for U.S.-made AI chips . This new restriction requires a 30-day notice to the Malaysian government before exporting any U.S. AI chips, indicating a growing trend of countries implementing their own controls to manage sensitive technology. U.S.-China Tensions Flare (May/July): Tensions between China and the U.S. escalated when China‚Äôs Commerce Secretary strongly reacted to U.S. guidance warning companies against using Huawei‚Äôs AI chips. This friction continued with U.S. Commerce Security Howard Lutnick linking the resumption of certain AI chip sales to China by U.S. companies (like Nvidia and AMD) to ongoing trade discussions regarding rare earth elements, illustrating the intricate web of dependencies and leverage points in global trade. DeepSeek‚Äôs ‚ÄòReasoning‚Äô Model (January): While not directly semiconductor news, the release of Chinese AI startup DeepSeek‚Äôs open R1 ‚Äòreasoning‚Äô model caused significant alarm in Silicon Valley. This development intensified concerns about China‚Äôs independent AI capabilities and further fueled calls for stringent chip export restrictions to maintain the U.S.‚Äôs technological lead. These events highlight how the US semiconductor market is not just an economic sector but a critical instrument of foreign policy and national security, constantly influenced by international dynamics. Beyond the Silicon: The Broader Tech Ecosystem and Bitcoin World Disrupt 2025 Amidst the high-stakes corporate maneuvers and geopolitical tensions, the broader tech ecosystem continued to innovate and convene. The Bitcoin World Disrupt 2025 event, celebrating its 20th anniversary in San Francisco, served as a crucial gathering point for tech and VC heavyweights. Figures from Netflix, ElevenLabs, Wayve, and Sequoia Capital joined the agenda, offering insights that fuel startup growth and sharpen industry edge. Such events underscore the interconnectedness of the tech world. While the direct focus of Disrupt 2025 might not have been solely on the US semiconductor market , the discussions on AI advancements, venture capital trends, and startup growth inherently rely on the foundational progress within the semiconductor industry. The availability of powerful AI chips , the impact of export restrictions , and the strategic direction of companies like Intel and Nvidia directly influence the viability and innovation potential of countless startups and established tech firms showcased at such conferences. The insights shared at Disrupt 2025 provided a vital pulse check on the industry‚Äôs health and future trajectory. A Pivotal Year for Semiconductors As 2025 concluded, it was clear that the US semiconductor market had undergone a period of intense transformation. From Intel ‚Äòs bold internal restructuring to Nvidia ‚Äòs strategic navigation of complex export restrictions , and the broader geopolitical chess match over AI chips , the year laid a critical foundation for the future. The industry‚Äôs trajectory remains intertwined with global power dynamics, technological innovation, and the relentless pursuit of AI supremacy. The lessons learned and the strategies implemented in 2025 will undoubtedly shape the competitive landscape and technological advancements for years to come. To learn more about the latest AI market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping AI features and institutional adoption. This post US Semiconductor Market: Unveiling the Crucial 2025 Transformations in AI Chips and Export Controls first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

headline: Bitcoin range-bound ahead of Fed decision, CFX, ENA post double digit weekly gains
summary: Bitcoin moved sideways this week, trading within a narrow range between $115,184 and $119,959. Momentum slowed heading into Friday, with no major breakout in either direction. The total cryptocurrency market cap briefly crossed the $4 trillion mark before retreating to $3.85 trillion. This reflected a decline of more than 6% late in the week. Broader sentiment remained bullish. The Crypto Fear and Greed Index stayed in greed territory, though it had fallen three points from the previous week at press time. Altcoins outperformed Bitcoin. While the leading cryptocurrency was down over 2% on the week, several high-cap tokens ended with double-digit gains. Why is Bitcoin stuck? Bitcoin remains range-bound as conflicting forces weigh on short-term price direction. A sharp rise in open interest, now at an all-time high of $44.5 billion, is a sign of a speculative market. This trend comes alongside falling prices, which happens when there is a buildup of leveraged positions that heightens the risk of sudden volatility and forced liquidations. Instead of long-term investors, the market is seeing a wave of short-term traders attempting to capitalise on rapid price swings. Analysts have observed that many are entering long positions without waiting for clear confirmation, a sign of heightened FOMO after Bitcoin briefly rallied from $116,000 to $120,000 earlier this week. That rally was quickly sold off, as larger players used the $120,000 mark to offload holdings, reinforcing it as a key resistance level. Binance data shows the price of perpetual contracts has moved above the spot rate, suggesting an upward bias during intraday moves. However, funding rates remain neutral, which means the market is largely undecided about the direction of the broader trend. Profit-taking is also limiting further upside. Bitcoin‚Äôs recent surge, which has taken it over 65% above its April lows, has prompted investors to lock in gains. This trend is playing out across the market, particularly among altcoins that have recorded stronger rallies. Broader macroeconomic uncertainty is another drag. The upcoming August 1 tariff deadline, with the US planning to impose sweeping trade restrictions, is fuelling risk-off sentiment. While agreements have been reached with Japan and the Philippines, talks with the EU and South Korea remain unresolved. Additionally, traders are cautious ahead of next week‚Äôs Federal Reserve meeting. While there is hope for a rate cut, officials have signalled that monetary easing is unlikely in July. With inflation ticking higher, most analysts now expect the first cut to come in September or October, delaying the kind of policy support that often boosts crypto markets. Will Bitcoin go up? Despite Bitcoin‚Äôs late-week slowdown, bullish conviction remains strong. A notable options trade on Deribit saw a high-net-worth investor place a $23.7 million bet on Bitcoin reaching $200,000 by year-end. The trade used a December $140K‚Äì$200K bull call spread, a setup that puts a ceiling on both risk and reward. Such whale activity often draws attention, as similar trades have shaped price action in previous cycles. Analysts view these structured bets as signs of long-term confidence, even as the market navigates short-term volatility. According to Deribit Insights, this structure leans on lower implied volatility at the $140K strike while offsetting costs with pricier $200K calls, essentially a calculated bet on Bitcoin breaking into record territory soon. Technical indicators also support the bullish view. According to Rekt Capital, Bitcoin continues to follow a broader price discovery trend and has retested key support levels on both daily and weekly timeframes. BTC/USD weekly chart. Source: Rekt Capital. Holding above $119,000 on the weekly close would keep the current bull flag breakout structure intact. Adding to the bull case, asset manager Swissblock said in a Friday post on X that the Bitcoin Risk Index remains at zero. This index measures the likelihood of significant price drawdowns in BTC. Swissblock @swissblock__ ¬∑ Follow Bitcoin finally broke out of its range‚Äî but this isn‚Äôt capitulation, it‚Äôs a rotation-led correction.‚Üí Risk Index = 0‚Üí No overheating‚Üí Structure intactThe trend remains bullish. Corrections at low risk levels = opportunity, not exit. 10:58 AM ¬∑ Jul 25, 2025 139 Reply Copy link Read 6 replies According to the firm, a zero reading suggests the market hasn‚Äôt overheated and still has room to move higher. Swissblock maintains that the current dip is a low-risk correction rather than a trend reversal, and described the late week dip as an opportunity rather than an exit signal. Other analysts, like Daan Crypto Trades, pointed to $115,000 as a key support level. A breakdown could lead to a retest of $113,500, which is being closely watched by traders as a potential entry point if Bitcoin drops lower. Daan Crypto Trades @DaanCrypto ¬∑ Follow $BTC Testing its range low and swept the local liquidity.Most of this sell off is coming from Galaxy Digital which has sent $2B+ of Bitcoin to exchanges to sell. This is still part of that 80K BTC whale. The Bitcoin price has stalled ever since those coins started moving.A 12:20 PM ¬∑ Jul 25, 2025 349 Reply Copy link Read 55 replies Meanwhile, some caution is also warranted, according to well-followed analyst Crypto TA King, who highlighted a symmetrical triangle breakdown on the 4-hour BTC/USDT chart. BTC/USD 4h Perpetual contract on Binance. Source: Crypto TA King. Based on the chart, Crypto TA King expects a potential move toward the $112,000‚Äì$113,000 range if the breakdown holds. At the time of writing, one Bitcoin was selling for $115,399, down 2.4% in the past 7-days. Altcoins close the week on a high note The altcoin market cap rose 7.7% to a weekly high of $1.67 trillion before it settled at $1.59 trillion, still up 2.5% over the 7-day period. Ethereum climbed to $3,800 earlier in the week, briefly lifting the broader altcoin market; however, the rally lost steam as selling pressure returned, leading to sideways movement heading into the weekend. By late Friday, most altcoins had given back a portion of their early-week gains. As of press time, Ethereum was up just 1.2% over the past seven days. Meanwhile, other major altcoins like XRP, Solana (SOL), Dogecoin (DOGE), Tron (TRX), and Cardano (ADA) saw losses between 4% and 12%. Conflux (CFX) saw the strongest rally this week among the top altcoins, up 69% while Ethena (ENA) and Pudgy Penguins (pengu) followed with 40.5% and 22% respectively. Source: CoinMarketCap Conflux : Conflux started gaining momentum after the team revealed its upcoming Conflux 3.0 upgrade, set to launch on July 31. The project is also working on key infrastructure to enable real-world asset tokenization and blockchain-powered cross-border trade. One major focus is a planned offshore Chinese yuan stablecoin, which could support China‚Äôs broader push to expand the global use of its currency via digital technology. Conflux has also teamed up with crypto wallet TokenPocket to promote the stablecoin among its users. Ethena : ENA‚Äôs price shot up late in the week as whales and influential figures, like Arthur Hayes, scooped up millions worth of the token. Such large-scale accumulation trends often trigger retail FOMO, drawing in retail interest that adds to the momentum. Another major catalyst is StablecoinX, a newly listed Nasdaq firm, which has started executing a large-scale ENA treasury strategy. Over the next six weeks, the company will allocate $260 million to ENA. This steady buying activity is beginning to influence the market and support the price. In addition, Ethena Labs has partnered with Anchorage Digital , a federally chartered crypto bank, to launch USDtb, the first stablecoin designed to comply with new US stablecoin regulations. Pudgy Penguins : PENGU‚Äôs rally is picking up steam thanks to a string of recent developments. First, it secured a listing on Gemini on July 22. It also announced two major partnerships, one with US motosports organisation NASCAR, and the other with Lufthansa, Germany‚Äôs largest airline. PENGU‚Äôs momentum picked up further after the U.S. SEC began reviewing the Canary Spot PENGU ETF. Moreover, sales numbers for the Pudgy penguins NFT collection have surged over the past weeks, which has helped instill market confidence in the meme coin. The post Bitcoin range-bound ahead of Fed decision, CFX, ENA post double digit weekly gains appeared first on Invezz

headline: Ethereum‚Äôs Rebound Isn‚Äôt Hype: On-Chain Signals Point to a Bigger Rally Ahead
summary: After enduring months of criticism for lagging behind other crypto assets, Ethereum is making a strong return as it reclaims market share. Despite the recent pullback, the altcoin appears to be closing in on $4,000. Whale Accumulation Hints at Much Bigger Move Underneath its price action, large holders are quietly gearing up to fuel the rally, new data from Santiment shows. Since early 2025, wallets holding 10,000 to 100,000 ETH have steadily accumulated, indicating institutional players are stepping in before mainstream retail hype takes over. Alongside this, Santiment also observed a rise in ETH-related social discussions, which suggests that the current surge is rooted in on-chain fundamentals and strategic positioning rather than short-term retail FOMO. The crypto analytic firm also found that, unlike previous cycles where ETH largely followed Bitcoin‚Äôs trajectory, Ethereum is showing its own independent momentum this time. Its market value ratio relative to Bitcoin has surged by 64% since May 8, 2025, which reflects how investor confidence is shifting back to the altcoin‚Äôs fundamentals. Interestingly, it was the deep bearish sentiment at the start of 2025 that may have set the stage for this rebound. ETH Sentiment Flips From Fear to Confidence When Ethereum touched $1,450 on April 8 this year, sentiment across crypto forums and social platforms was bleak. On X, Reddit, and Telegram, bullish-to-bearish comment ratios sat around 3:5, which indicated fear and doubt at their peak. Historically, such fear often precedes opportunity, and this cycle has been no exception. By late July, as Ethereum climbed, sentiment flipped decisively to a 2:1 bullish-to-bearish ratio, which pointed to a return of trader confidence. Santiment notes that this transformation is a stark contrast to the panic seen in early spring, but it also hints at pockets of FOMO beginning to surface. However, the current sentiment is cooler than the ‚Äúfrothy‚Äù 3.5:1 bullish ratio recorded in mid-June, which suggests that optimism has moderated while maintaining constructive momentum. This moderation could serve as a healthier foundation for the rally to resume if bullish commentary continues to cool. Adding to the optimism are supportive headlines. Fundstrat‚Äôs Tom Lee recently predicted that the crypto asset could reach $10,000-$15,000, owing to ETF inflows, institutional demand, and AI infrastructure tailwinds as catalysts. The post Ethereum‚Äôs Rebound Isn‚Äôt Hype: On-Chain Signals Point to a Bigger Rally Ahead appeared first on CryptoPotato .

headline: Wall Street Giant Citi Has Released Its New Predictions for the Price of Bitcoin: ‚ÄúIn a Pessimistic Scenario, $64,000; In an Optimistic Scenario‚Ä¶‚Äù
summary: Wall Street bank Citi has released a new year-end Bitcoin forecast reflecting the evolving dynamics in the digital asset market. Citi's most optimistic scenario has Bitcoin reaching as high as $199,000 by the end of the year, while a more pessimistic scenario sees it plummet to an estimated $64,000, primarily due to weak stock performance. Citi's updated forecast considers three main factors: user adoption, macroeconomic conditions, and demand for spot exchange-traded funds (ETFs). The bank noted that these factors will significantly shape Bitcoin's price. At the heart of his company's approach is an adoption model based on user activity. The bank's analysts predict a 20% increase in user growth and linear network effects, noting that this factor alone could push Bitcoin's price to around $75,000. Related News: BREAKING NEWS: Coinbase Adds Surprise Altcoin to its Roadmap for Listing Macroeconomic factors, driven by weak stocks and gold performance, lowered the forecast by $3,200, while an estimated $15 billion in ETF inflows added $63,000 to the price estimate. Consequently, the base-case year-end target was set at $135,000. ETF flows have become a central force in Bitcoin‚Äôs price action since the approval of US spot products in January 2024. Citi noted that these flows alone account for over 40% of the recent BTC price change and are given a major role in its new model. The bank noted that while the adoption curve is still the cornerstone of the model, the integration of cryptocurrencies with traditional finance through ETFs, index inclusion, and growing regulatory acceptance is increasing the importance of macroeconomic and institutional flows. Citi analysts say the risk to their forecast is on the upside. They note that ETF demand is growing faster than expected and user activity is declining slower than the model predicts, highlighting that network effects may persist longer than expected. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Wall Street Giant Citi Has Released Its New Predictions for the Price of Bitcoin: ‚ÄúIn a Pessimistic Scenario, $64,000; In an Optimistic Scenario‚Ä¶‚Äù

headline: Bitcoin Price Surges Past $116,000: What‚Äôs Driving This Monumental Rally?
summary: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Price Surges Past $116,000: What‚Äôs Driving This Monumental Rally? The crypto world is buzzing with renewed vigor! Bitcoin price , the undisputed pioneer of digital assets, has once again captured global headlines, ascending majestically past the significant $116,000 mark. This impressive rally, meticulously observed by market monitoring platforms like Bitcoin World and widely reported across major exchanges such as Binance, has ignited a fresh wave of excitement and intense speculation across the digital asset landscape. For both seasoned investors and curious newcomers, the central question remains: what powerful forces are fueling this extraordinary ascent, and what profound implications does this have for the future trajectory of your digital portfolio? What‚Äôs Behind the Ascent of Bitcoin Price? Understanding the dynamics that propel the Bitcoin price requires a look at a confluence of factors, ranging from institutional adoption to macroeconomic shifts and the inherent design of the cryptocurrency itself. This isn‚Äôt just a random fluctuation; it‚Äôs the result of growing confidence and increasing utility in the digital asset space. Several key drivers are contributing to Bitcoin‚Äôs remarkable performance: Institutional Influx: The escalating interest and direct investment from institutional players are a major catalyst. The approval and launch of spot Bitcoin Exchange-Traded Funds (ETFs) in major markets have opened regulated pathways for traditional finance to gain exposure to Bitcoin. This creates substantial demand pressure from large institutions, hedge funds, and corporate treasuries, lending immense credibility and liquidity to the market. Macroeconomic Headwinds: In an era characterized by persistent inflation and geopolitical uncertainties, traditional fiat currencies are under scrutiny. Investors are seeking alternative stores of value. Bitcoin, with its decentralized nature and fixed supply, is increasingly viewed as ‚Äúdigital gold‚Äù ‚Äì a hedge against inflation and a potential safe haven during economic instability, drawing in capital from those looking to preserve purchasing power. The Halving Cycle‚Äôs Influence: Bitcoin‚Äôs supply schedule is governed by ‚Äúhalving‚Äù events, occurring approximately every four years, which cut the reward for mining new blocks in half. This deflationary mechanism reduces the rate at which new Bitcoins enter circulation, contributing to long-term scarcity and often influencing the Bitcoin price positively over time. Technological Evolution and Network Health: The underlying Bitcoin network continues to evolve and strengthen with developments in scaling solutions, security enhancements, and broader integration into financial systems. A robust and secure network fosters greater trust and encourages wider adoption, crucial for sustained price growth. Growing Retail Interest: As Bitcoin makes headlines, it naturally attracts renewed attention from individual investors. The ‚ÄúFear Of Missing Out‚Äù (FOMO) phenomenon can lead to a surge in retail buying, creating a positive feedback loop that further propels the price upwards. The Domino Effect: How Bitcoin Price Impacts the Wider Crypto Market Bitcoin‚Äôs position as the largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization means its movements often dictate the broader sentiment and direction of the entire crypto market. It acts as the market‚Äôs bellwether, and a significant shift in Bitcoin price can send ripples through the ecosystem, affecting altcoins, decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols, and non-fungible tokens (NFTs). Here‚Äôs how Bitcoin‚Äôs performance creates a domino effect: Market Dominance and Sentiment: Bitcoin typically holds a substantial portion of the total cryptocurrency market capitalization. When Bitcoin rallies, it signals a healthy market, boosting overall investor confidence. This positive sentiment frequently spills over into altcoins, leading to what is often referred to as an ‚Äúaltcoin season.‚Äù Conversely, a sharp drop in Bitcoin‚Äôs value can trigger widespread sell-offs across the altcoin market. Liquidity and Capital Flows: Bitcoin‚Äôs liquidity is unparalleled. When new capital enters the market, it often flows into Bitcoin first. As Bitcoin‚Äôs price stabilizes or reaches milestones, some of that capital might then rotate into altcoins, seeking higher percentage gains. This capital rotation is common in bull markets. Psychological Impact: Bitcoin‚Äôs price movements have a profound psychological impact on investors. A surging Bitcoin can create a sense of optimism and a belief that a bull market is firmly in place, encouraging more risk-taking across the board. This collective psychological shift can fuel rallies in other assets. Navigating the Volatility: Risks and Rewards for Bitcoin Price Investors While the recent surge in Bitcoin price is exhilarating, it‚Äôs crucial for investors to approach the cryptocurrency market with a balanced perspective, acknowledging both its immense potential rewards and its inherent risks. Bitcoin, like all nascent asset classes, is subject to significant volatility, which can lead to rapid gains but also substantial losses. Potential Rewards: High Growth Potential: Bitcoin has historically delivered exceptional returns over longer periods. Its relatively young age means it still has significant room for growth as adoption increases. Store of Value: Bitcoin is increasingly seen as a superior store of value due to its scarcity and censorship resistance, offering a hedge against inflation and economic uncertainty. Global Accessibility: It allows anyone with an internet connection to send and receive value across borders without intermediaries. Portfolio Diversification: Bitcoin can offer diversification benefits, as its price movements are not always perfectly correlated with traditional markets. Inherent Risks: Extreme Price Volatility: Bitcoin‚Äôs price can experience dramatic swings, sometimes dropping by 20-50% or more in days or weeks. This high volatility makes it unsuitable for low-risk tolerance investors. Regulatory Uncertainty: The evolving global regulatory landscape poses a risk. Potential bans or restrictive policies could significantly impact Bitcoin‚Äôs value and adoption. Security Concerns: Investors face risks from hacking, phishing scams, and loss of private keys. Secure storage practices are paramount. Market Manipulation: The market can be susceptible to manipulation by large holders (whales) or coordinated actions. It is paramount for any investor to conduct thorough due diligence (DYOR ‚Äì Do Your Own Research) and never invest more than they can afford to lose. Implementing robust risk management strategies, such as setting stop-loss orders or diversifying portfolios, is highly advisable. What Does the Future Hold for Bitcoin Price? Predicting the exact future trajectory of Bitcoin price is complex. However, based on current trends and expert analysis, we can identify several key themes and potential scenarios. In the short term, Bitcoin‚Äôs price will likely remain sensitive to macroeconomic data (inflation, interest rates) and significant regulatory news. Geopolitical events and traditional financial market performance will also play a role. Periods of consolidation or corrections after significant rallies are healthy for market absorption. Long-term, the outlook for Bitcoin appears robust, underpinned by its fundamental strengths and growing mainstream acceptance. Increasing integration into global financial systems, driven by institutional products like ETFs, is expected to provide a stable foundation for continued growth. Ongoing technological advancements and broader blockchain adoption are likely to enhance its utility and value. Actionable Insights for Investors: Stay Informed: Base decisions on reliable data and your own research. Understand Bitcoin‚Äôs technology and economic principles. Practice Dollar-Cost Averaging (DCA): Invest a fixed amount regularly to mitigate volatility and potentially achieve a lower average purchase price. Diversify Your Portfolio: Consider a well-rounded crypto portfolio, but always prioritize quality and strong fundamentals. Prioritize Security: Use strong passwords, 2FA, and hardware wallets for significant amounts. Be wary of scams. Understand Your Risk Tolerance: Only invest capital you are prepared to lose. Define goals and exit strategy clearly. Think Long-Term: Bitcoin‚Äôs significant gains have historically been over multi-year periods. Focus on long-term potential. The journey of Bitcoin has been revolutionary, transforming financial paradigms. The recent surge past $116,000 is a powerful testament to Bitcoin‚Äôs enduring resilience, growing mainstream acceptance, and potential to reshape the global financial landscape. While the path forward will undoubtedly present volatility and challenges, the fundamental drivers behind Bitcoin‚Äôs ascent appear to be strengthening. For those navigating this dynamic market, informed decision-making, strategic patience, and robust security practices will be key to harnessing the opportunities Bitcoin continues to present. As the digital economy evolves, Bitcoin stands poised at the forefront, continuing its monumental journey. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: Is $116,000 an all-time high for Bitcoin? A1: While a significant milestone, $116,000 is not Bitcoin‚Äôs all-time high. Bitcoin has reached higher valuations in previous market cycles. This price point signifies a robust recovery and strong upward momentum. Q2: What are the primary factors influencing Bitcoin‚Äôs price movements? A2: The Bitcoin price is influenced by institutional adoption (ETFs), macroeconomic conditions (inflation), supply shocks (halving), regulatory developments, technological advancements, and overall market sentiment. Q3: Is it too late to invest in Bitcoin? A3: This depends on your investment horizon and risk tolerance. Many analysts believe it still has significant long-term growth potential due to increasing global adoption. However, past performance is not indicative of future results, and careful research is always advised. Q4: How can I securely store my Bitcoin? A4: For maximum security, use a hardware wallet (cold storage) for significant amounts. For smaller amounts, reputable exchanges with strong security (2FA) can be used. Always be vigilant against phishing scams. If you found this comprehensive analysis of Bitcoin‚Äôs recent surge insightful, consider sharing it with your network! Help us spread valuable knowledge about the evolving cryptocurrency landscape by sharing this article on your social media platforms. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action. This post Bitcoin Price Surges Past $116,000: What‚Äôs Driving This Monumental Rally? first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

headline: Joseph Chalom joins SharpLink Gaming as co-CEO, jumps ship from BlackRock
summary: SharpLink Gaming welcomed Joseph Chalom as its co-CEO. Chalom brings experience from his stint as head of digital assets at BlackRock and is a known Ethereum maximalist, who has helped bridge crypto and traditional finance. Chalom was behind the creation of BlackRock‚Äôs most prominent products, combining crypto and TradFi. He spent 20 years with the company, helping usher in the latest round of crypto products. Chalom worked on the IBIT ETF , the Ethereum product ETHA, as well as the tokenized money market instrument BUIDL . After 20 years at BlackRock and helping to lead its digital asset strategy, I‚Äôm beginning a new chapter: I‚Äôve joined @SharpLinkGaming as Co-CEO. Here‚Äôs why. At BlackRock, I helped launch: ‚Äì IBIT ‚Äî world‚Äôs largest Bitcoin ETP ‚Äì ETHA ‚Äî world‚Äôs largest Ethereum ETP ‚Äì BUIDL ‚Äî‚Ä¶ ‚Äî Joseph Chalom (@joechalom) July 25, 2025 SharpLink Gaming to reshuffle leadership Chalom stated that joining the SharpLink gaming team would further expand the Ethereum ecosystem by actively using the company‚Äôs treasury. ‚Äú I‚Äôm joining SharpLink with a clear mission: to help build the most trusted Ethereum treasury and to bring Ethereum to the center of global finance,‚Äù wrote Chalom after updating his position at the new company. With Chalom assuming his new role, the current CEO and co-founder of SharpLink Gaming, Robert Phythian , will take the role of President and shift his responsibilities. After the shift in leadership, SharpLink Gaming aims to work in alignment with Ethereum to use the network as the leading financial hub, connecting on-chain and traditional liquidity. ‚Äú Few executives in the world have had the kind of impact Joseph has had in unlocking institutional adoption of digital assets, having pioneered BlackRock‚Äôs strategic entry into the space. His decision to join SharpLink is a resounding validation of our ETH treasury strategy and vision for Ethereum to drive profound, transformative change across the global digital economy,‚Äù stated Joseph Lubin, SharpLink Chairman, Co-Founder of Ethereum and Founder and CEO of Consensys. Before joining SharpLink Gaming, Chalom held key leadership roles at BlackRock . During his crypto tenure, he completed partnerships with key platforms, including Nasdaq, Coinbase, Anchorage Digital Bank, BNY Mellon, and Circle. Additionally, SharpLink Gaming has demonstrated its alignment with the Ethereum Foundation and its growth values. The bond was demonstrated after the recent OTC deal for 10,000 ETH from the Foundation‚Äôs initial ICO reserves. SharpLink Gaming holds the second-biggest ETH treasury SharpLink Gaming still holds the second-biggest ETH treasury of 360,809 ETH, on par with some of the biggest ICO projects. However, unlike ICOs, the treasury companies will not sell the ETH for operating expenses. Instead, SharpLink aims to use the token for staking and passive income. Currently, most of the ETH in the company‚Äôs treasury is staked, with liquidity issued in LSETH, a liquid staking token. The company holds only 52.56 ETH outright in its known public wallet . Despite having the second-biggest treasury, SharpLink Gaming is the biggest and most established corporation to deliberately grow its ETH reserves. The company aims to secure 1M ETH in its treasury, far surpassing even the Ethereum Foundation. At the same time, SBET shares are being represented on-chain. Injective (INJ) launched a native tokenized version of SBET shares. Currently, SBET is trading at $22, down from its recent local high of $37.36 achieved earlier in July.
